page.title: 08 TORBAY RAILWAY
page.content: The Dartmouth and Torbay Railway was opened on August 16th 1864.The station buildings were completed several months later.The line was operated by the South Devon railway. It is now operated by the Dart valley Railway Association,a private company. Kingswear is at the end of the line from Paignton.There are two lines of track beween Paignton and Kingswear. Originally both lines were broad gauge but in May 1892 the track was converted in one weekend to the standard gauge now used. The engines are all original steam engines and the trains are painted in the original livery. Christine Porter,Emma Newman, Adele Grant.
